I need help with this. I do not very know a Slick and I'm not sure about transactionality every `SimpleJdbcAction`.
It works in tests and our application, but I'm not sure that it's absolutely correct.

I don't get your question about transactionality. 

This DBIO will have a single statement and will run in its own transaction and not participating to any other transaction. If the user had access to it they could `flatMap` with another DBIO. In that case, they will need to add `.transactionally` to wrap both DBIO on the same tx. 

Anyway, that's not applicable here. 

However, what could be an addition is a `BiFunction[T, Connection, List[PreparedStatement]]`. 

The user could then return a few prepared statements, all bound to the same connection. 

In such a case, we would convert each of them to a DBIO and indeed execute them in the same transaction using `.transactionally`.

Can be added on another PR though.

> This DBIO will have a single statement and will run in its own transaction and not participating to any other transaction.

Exactly this is what I wanted to clarify. Thank you! ðŸ‘
